Legal_Issue: Whether the visa officer erred in law by failing to assess the applicant's experience in multiple occupations and whether there was a breach of fairness
Evidence_Assessment: Applicant's occupational responsibilities and experience across multiple roles
Burden_of_Proof: On the applicant to demonstrate eligibility under immigration regulations
Legal_Rule: Applicants can be assessed based on their intended occupation; fairness requires providing reasons and allowing presentation of relevant information
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness or correctness, based on legal error and procedural fairness
Procedural_Issue: Failure to consider all relevant occupations and lack of adequate reasoning
Grounds_for_Claim: Misinterpretation of regulations regarding occupational experience and breach of procedural fairness
Outcome_on_Merits: The visa officer committed an error of law and breached fairness duties
Review_Standard: Legality and procedural fairness under the Immigration Act and Regulations
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Breach of fairness due to failure to provide adequate reasons and consider all relevant information
Key_Evidence_Considered: Applicant's experience, responsibilities, and paragraph 15 of the Baker affidavit
Applicant_Challenge: Denial of immigration application based on narrow interpretation of occupational duties
Court_Result: Decision set aside; respondent directed to reassess application
Legal_Rule_Source: Immigration Regulations, 1978; Baker v. Canada (Minister of Citizenship and Immigration)
Defendant_Response: Refusal based on inability to break down applicant's responsibilities into separate components
Outcome: Application allowed; case remitted for reassessment
Remedy_Sought: Quashing of decision and direction for reassessment
Legal_Provision: Immigration Regulations, 1978, paragraph related to occupational assessment
Legal_Provision_Cited: Paragraph 15 of the Baker affidavit, Immigration Regulations, 1978
Jurisdiction: Immigration and Refugee Board / Federal Court
Governing_Rule: Immigration Regulations, 1978, fairness principles in administrative decision-making
